result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelley J Bishop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants sentence credit from March 27, 2014, thru today if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
2.  Abide with any CHIPS orders currently in place or to be in place.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelley J Bishop

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Agent Melissa Schneiter - defendant has paid off all obligations.

1:22 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Melissa Schneiter present in court via telephone.  Court goes over monies due.  Statement by defendant.  Statement by Agent Schneiter - met with defendant in February.  Statement by defendant.  Court finds that the defendant has made no effort to pay off and extends probation for a period of one year.  Court informs defendant that if money is still owed, the Court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Agent to submit paperwork for 1 year extension.

Court adjourned at 1:27 p.m.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Response letter to the defendant from Hon. Mark T. Slate
dated July 1, 2014 to Judge Slate from the defendant

No Contact Provision has been cancelled. 
44

3:37 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney John Selsing.

ADA recites agremeent - amend to misdemeanor of child neglect in violation of  948.21(1)(a).  Attorney Selsing concurs.  Defendant concurs.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to the amended charge.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to the amended charge and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  ADA confirms compliance with any victim/witness rights.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Selsing.  No statement by the defendant.

Court orders SWD and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Pay court costs.
Abide with all other rules/recommendations of probation as imposed by the supervising agent.
Abide with any CHIPS orders currently in place or to be put in place.

Court grants sentence credit from March 27, 2014 thru today if probation is revoked.

Court adjourned at 3:44 p.m.
Columbia County Jail - May 20, 2014 at 3:00 p.m. (Plea & Sentencing)
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 20, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

11:05 a.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney John Selsing.

Statement by Attorney Selsing - requests a waiver of the time limits as to the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.

9:11 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Reisha Mitchell.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Mitchell confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court notes that bond has been set.  Statement by Atty Mitchell, defendant requests a prelim and does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing next week, possibly Tuesday morning.

Court adjourned at 9:12 a.m.

No Contact with the co-defendant Michael B. Jr. and No Contact with the victim - JJJK (01/16/2009). 3:10 p.m.  Defendant present in custody, and in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail.  Patrick Taylor, Special Prosecutor for State of Wisconsin and via telephone.  Statement by Special Prosecutor regarding referral from Berlin Police Dept.  Special Pros makes bond recommendation.  Court orders $25,000.00 cash bond and conditions of:  No Contact with the co-defendant Michael B. Jr. and No Contact with the victim - JJJK (01/16/2009).  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Status to be held in 2 weeks.
